title: Club Rules and Safety Guides
subtitle: Our principles for safe, respectful, and environmentally friendly adventures in the mountains. Your safety and the preservation of nature are our top priorities.
safety1_content: Always carry the 'ten essentials' adapted to the route and weather: navigation (map, compass, GPS), sun protection (sunglasses, sunscreen), insulation (extra clothing), illumination (headlamp), first-aid kit, fire (lighter, matches), repair kit (knife, tape), nutrition, hydration, and an emergency shelter.
safety2_content: Always consult official weather forecast sources (AEMET, mountain weather reports). Plan your route, know the distance, elevation profile, and escape routes. Inform someone of your plans.
safety3_content: Be honest about your physical and technical abilities. Choose routes appropriate for your level. It's not a disgrace to turn back if conditions are bad or you don't feel safe. The mountain will always be there.
lnt_title: Leave No Trace: Our Commitment to the Environment
lnt1_content: Know the regulations and special concerns for the area you'll visit. Travel in small groups and avoid peak times to minimize impact.
lnt2_trigger: Travel and Camp on Durable Surfaces
lnt2_content: Stay on existing trails. Camp at least 200 feet (about 60 meters) from lakes and rivers to protect riparian areas.
lnt3_content: Pack it in, pack it out. This includes food scraps like fruit peels. Inspect your campsite for trash before you leave.
lnt4_content: Observe wildlife from a distance. Never feed animals, as it harms their health and alters their behavior. Control your pets at all times.
etiquette_title: Mountain Etiquette: Coexisting on the Trail
etiquette1_content: A simple greeting creates a positive atmosphere. Be patient with other users who may be slower or less experienced.
etiquette2_title: Right of Way on the Trail
etiquette2_content: Hikers going uphill have the right of way, as they require more effort. If you need to pass, announce it kindly and pass where it is safe.
etiquette3_content: Enjoy the sounds of nature. Avoid loud conversations and the use of speakers. Many people seek the peace and quiet of the mountains.
